key_questions_answered.user_goals: GMs want to easily configure descriptor-based animations that automatically play. Players want visual feedback when powers are activated. Both want support for infinite power combinations through reusable components.
key_questions_answered.primary_users: Game Masters and Players using Foundry VTT for MM3E games
key_questions_answered.first_action: Using an animation configured out of the box (automatically associated with a descriptor)
key_questions_answered.problems_solved: The need to create animations from scratch for every single possible power. Currently takes a long time to develop a new animation associated with a power. In an effects-based system, you can have infinite number of power combinations, so manually creating animations for each is impossible.
key_questions_answered.struggles: Players currently get stuck in that it takes a long time to develop a new animation associated with a power. The current system requires a lot of manual work to assemble sequencer components.
key_questions_answered.integrations: Foundry VTT core, foundry-mm3 system (new Mutants and Masterminds system), Sequencer module (for animations), Token Magic FX (small reliance), JB2A and other animation content providers. NOTE: Automated Animations (autorec) integration is NOT needed - we will not be doing anything that works with automated animations.
key_questions_answered.stakeholder_groups: Foundry VTT MM3E community, module developers
key_questions_answered.first_user_action: Install the module, configure descriptor animations (either use defaults or customize via visual editor), then use a power item in-game which automatically triggers the appropriate animation
key_questions_answered.problems_eliminated: Manual animation setup for every power combination, lack of reusable animation components, boilerplate repetition in animation definitions, poor integration with new foundry-mm3 system
key_questions_answered.user_struggles: Currently having to manually create animations for each power descriptor/range/area/effect combination, repeating similar code patterns, lack of visual editor for rapid animation composition
key_questions_answered.system_integrations: Foundry VTT core system, Sequencer module (required), JB2A Patreon assets, Jacks Cartoon Spell Effects, Jinkers Animation, FXMaster, Token Magic FX, new foundry-mm3 system (https://github.com/Ethaks/foundry-mm3)
key_questions_answered.integration_behaviors: Module hooks into Foundry VTT power roll events (rollPower, attackRolled), looks up animations based on power item attributes (descriptor, range, area, effect), executes Sequencer animations, integrates with foundry-mm3 attack system which has better built-in attack functionality
key_questions_answered.distinct_user_types: Game Masters (GMs) who configure animations and Players who trigger animations during gameplay
key_questions_answered.primary_stakeholders: Foundry VTT MM3E community, module developers, GMs and Players using the foundry-mm3 system
